Note to myself. Use the file.info function to move only recently changed files.

## Get files

```{r prelims}
backup_flag <- TRUE
library(dplyr)
library(glue)
library(knitr)
library(magrittr)
library(stringr)
yrs <- c(paste0("0", 0:9), as.character(c(10:24, 99)))
all_files <- NULL
for (y in rev(yrs)) {
  f0 <- "../text"
  fn <- list.files(glue("{f0}/{y}"))
  if (length(fn)==0) next
  data.frame(y, fn) %>%
    bind_rows(all_files) -> all_files
}
count(all_files, y)
```


## Split files by extension

```{r split}
all_files %>%
  mutate(ext=str_remove(fn, ".*\\.")) %>%
  mutate(fn=str_remove(fn, "\\..*")) -> all_files
count(all_files, ext)
```

## Find files without md, Rmd extensions

```{r find}
all_files %>%
  filter(ext != "md") %>%
  filter(ext != "Rmd")
```

## Remove html files

```{r remove}
all_files %>%
  filter(ext == "html") %>%
  mutate(f=glue("{f0}/{y}/{fn}.{ext}")) %>%
  pull(f) -> g
g
if (length(g) > 0) {
  file.remove(g)
  cat("Removing", length(g), "files:", paste0(g, collapse=", "))
}
```

## Define directories for copying

```{r set-dir}
b0 <- "c:/Users"
b1 <- str_subset(list.files(b0), "steve|simons")
b2 <- "steve/Dropbox/professional"
b3 <- "fun stuff/update-website/md"
b4 <- glue("{b0}/{b1}/{b2}/{b3}")
b5 <- glue("{b4}/{Sys.Date()}")
```

## Backup old files

```{r backup, eval=backup_flag}
run_backup <- 
  !file.exists(b5)
if (run_backup) {
  dir.create(b1)
  f <- list.files(b4, pattern="md")
  cat("Backing up", length(f), "files")
  file.copy(
    from=glue("{b4}/{f}"),
    to=glue("{b5}/{f}"),
    overwrite=TRUE)
}
```

## Copy md files

```{r md}
all_files %>%
  filter(ext == "md") %>%
  mutate(a=glue("{f0}/{y}/{fn}.{ext}")) %>%
  mutate(b=glue("{b4}/{fn}.{ext}")) %>%
  select(a, b, fn) -> md
head(md)
success <- file.copy(from=md$a, to=md$b, overwrite=TRUE)
if (success) cat("\nAll files copied without error")
if (!success) {
  cat("\nError in file copy: ")
  cat(paste0(md$fn[!success], collapse=", "))
}
```

## Knit and copy Rmd files

```{r rmd, eval=FALSE}
all_files %>%
  filter(ext == "Rmd") %>%
  mutate(a=glue("{f0}/{y}/{fn}.Rmd")) %>%
  mutate(b=glue("{b0}/{fn}.md")) %>%
  select(a, b) -> Rmd
head(Rmd)
n <- nrow(Rmd)
n <- 3
for (i in 1:nrow(Rmd)) {
  knit(input=Rmd$a[i], output=Rmd$b[i])
}
length(list.files(b0))
```
